originally published by michie city publications company charlottesville virginia 1964 ____________ > preface this volume as originally published constituted the first revision and codification of the general ordinances of the city of liberty missouri since 1931 it contained the charter and such of the ordinances of a general and permanent nature passed on or before  as were found desirable for retention except those expressly saved from repeal by the adopting as now supplemented contains ordinances up to and including the ordinance indicated on the page of instructions for handling supplemental pages the ordinances were codified edited and indexed by the editorial staff of michie city publications company under the supervision of chas w sublett stephen c willard and m paul cook the publishers wish to express their appreciation for the cooperation of all the city officials and employees during the preparation of this publication particular acknowledgment is due the honorable wesley m smith mayor mr gary c clifton city attorney and mr charles s anderson city administrator for their assistance during the progress of the work a feature to which the attention of the user is directed is the arrangement of the chapters in alphabetical order attention is also directed to the analysis preceding each chapter which in many instances will serve as an index within itself the general index carried at the end of the has been carefully prepared and should serve as an accurate medium for locating the individual sections of law within the the footnotes appearing throughout the be found references to the charter and the applicable state law these notes also contain cross references to other and related provisions in the city reference to the historical citations appearing at the end of each section the user will be able to ascertain the ordinance from which the present section has been derived it is a recognized fact that if any to accomplish its intended purpose it must be kept up to date by means of an adequate supplemental service accordingly the publishers point out the advisability and necessity of keeping this the new city presented to the officials and citizens of the city of liberty missouri in the belief that it will merit their approval michie city publications company charlottesville virginia commencing with the publication of supplement no 14 in 198 supplementation of the been provide by municipal of tallahassee florida the been republished by municipal in 2002 with the inclusion of ordinances received for codification subsequent to supplement no 37 to the 1964 publication the page numbering system used in the republication of this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes charter cht1 charter comparative table chtct1 cda1 table cct1 cdi1 the republication of the under the direct supervision of robert s hornyak editor and credit is gratefully given to the members of the publishers staff for their able assistance throughout the project ordinance no 2933 entitled an ordinance adopting the liberty city code be it ordained by the city council of the city of liberty missouri as follows the ordinances embraced in this and the following chapters and sections shall constitute and be designated the the city of liberty missouri and be so cited such ordinances may also be cited as liberty city  in the construction of this of all other ordinances of the city the following definitions and rules of construction shall be observed unless it shall be otherwise expressly provided in any section or ordinance or unless inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city council or unless the context clearly requires otherwise chief administrative officer wherever the words chief administrative officer appear in this they shall mean the city administrator city the words the city or this city shall mean the city of liberty missouri city council the words city council or the council shall mean the city council of liberty computation of time the time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first and including the last day and if the last day is sunday or a legal holiday that shall be excluded county the words the county shall mean the county of clay state of missouri gender when any subject matter party or person is described or referred to by words importing the masculine females as well as males and associations and bodies corporate as well as individuals shall be deemed to be included joint authority words importing joint authority to three or more persons shall be construed as authority to a majority of such persons month the word month shall mean a calendar month number when any subject matter party or person is described or referred to by words importing the singular number the plural and separate matters and persons and bodies corporate shall be deemed to be included oath the word oath shall be construed to include an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed owner the word owner applied to a building or land shall include any part owner joint owner tenant in common joint tenant or tenant by the entirety of the whole or a part of such building or land person the word person shall include a corporation firm partnership association organization and any other group acting as a unit as well as individuals it shall also include an executor administrator trustee receiver or other representative appointed according to law whenever the word person is used in any section of the a penalty or fine as to partnerships or associations the word shall include the partners or members thereof and as to corporations shall include the officers agents or members thereof who are responsible for any violation of such section preceding following the words preceding and following shall mean next before and next after respectively property the word property shall include real and tangible and intangible personal property public way the words public way shall include any street alley boulevard parkway highway sidewalk or other public thoroughfare real property the terms real property premises real estate or lands shall be deemed to be coextensive with lands tenements and hereditaments shall may the word shall is mandatory and the word may is permissive sidewalk the word sidewalk shall mean that portion of the street between the curb line and the adjacent property line which is intended for the use of pedestrians including sidewalks over private property where curb line and property line are the same signature where the written signature of any person is required the proper handwriting of such person or his mark shall be intended state the words the state or this state shall mean the state of missouri street the word street shall mean and include any public way highway street avenue boulevard parkway alley or other public thoroughfare and each of such words shall include all of them tangible personal property tangible personal property shall include goods chattels and all personal property except intangible personal property tenant occupant the word tenant or occupant applied to a building or land shall include any person who occupies the whole or a part of such building or land whether alone or with others writing the words writing and written shall include printing lithographing or any other mode of representing words and letters year the word year shall mean a calendar year unless otherwise expressed and the word year shall be equivalent to the words year of our lord all general provisions terms phrases and expressions contained in this be liberally construed in order that the true intent and meaning of the city council may be fully carried out the catchlines of the several sections of this in boldface type are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and shall not be deemed or taken to be titles of such section nor as any part of the section nor unless expressly so provided shall they be so deemed when any of such sections including the catchlines are amended or reenacted the provisions appearing in this so far as they are the same as those of ordinances existing at the time of the adoption of the the city of liberty missouri shall be considered as a continuation thereof and not as new enactments it is hereby declared to be the intention of the city council that the sections paragraphs sentences clauses and phrases of this severable and if any phrase clause sentence paragraph or section of the be declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by the valid judgment or decree of any court of competent jurisdiction such unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect any of the remaining phrases clauses sentences paragraphs and sections of this the same would have been enacted by the city council without the incorporation in this any such unconstitutional or invalid phrase clause sentence paragraph or section whenever any ordinance or part of an ordinance shall be repealed or modified either expressly or by implication by a subsequent ordinance the ordinance or part of an ordinance thus repealed or modified shall continue in force until the ordinance repealing or modifying the same shall go into effect unless therein otherwise expressly provided  but no suit prosecution proceeding right fine or penalty instituted created given secured or accrued under any ordinance previous to its repeal shall in anywise be affected released or discharged but may be prosecuted enjoyed and recovered as fully as if such ordinance or provisions had continued in force unless it shall be therein otherwise expressly provided when an ordinance repealing a former ordinance clause or provision shall itself be repealed such repeal shall not be construed to revive such former ordinance clause or provision unless it be expressly so provided and such former ordinance clause or provision is set forth at length this ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage by the city council and approval by the mayor passed by the city council this 8th day of september 1969 s wesley m smith mayor attest s betty j bell city clerk approved by the mayor this 8th day of september 1969 s wesley m smith mayor supplement history table the include 18 11011 121718 include 18 11012 121718 include 18 part i  the charter footnotes  1  editors note the city of liberty operates under a special charter approved by the state of missouri on  thus liberty is a special charter city as that term is defined by rsmo  such special charter as amended is set forth in this volume as approved by the state of missouri except for certain editorial changes such as the employment of uniform capitalization supplying catchlines and frontal analysis article i  incorporation  form of government  powers  wards be it enacted by the general assembly of the state of missouri as follows incorporation all that district of country contained within one mile square of which the court house of clay county in the city of liberty is the center the sides of the square being respectfully parallel to the corresponding sides of said court house shall be and the same is hereby erected into a city by the name of the city of liberty and the inhabitants thereof are hereby constituted a body corporate and politic by the name and style of the mayor councilmen and citizens of the city of liberty  and by that name they and their successors forever shall have perpetual succession shall sue and be sued implead and be impleaded defend and be defended in all courts of law and equity and in all actions whatsoever  may contract and be contracted with  may purchase receive and hold property real and personal within said city and may sell lease or dispose of the same for the use and benefit of the city  and may purchase receive and hold property real and personal beyond the limits of the city to be used as cemetery grounds for the use of the city or for the establishment of a hospital for the reception of persons infected with contagious or other diseases or for the erection of a poorhouse and farm or work house or house of correction  and may sell lease or dispose of such property for the benefit of the city  and may do all the acts as natural persons  they may have and use a common seal and may break alter change and make a new seal at pleasure wards the city of liberty hereby created as soon as may be shall be divided into six wards by the present council of said city so as to include as near as may be the same number of free white male inhabitants in each ward  and the city council shall have power to alter or change the boundaries of said wards from time to time as they may see fit or to increase or diminish the number of said wards having a regard to the number of free white male inhabitants as aforesaid so that each ward shall have as aforesaid as near as may be an equal number of male inhabitants article ii  the council number  election the corporate powers of the inhabitants hereby incorporated under the name and style of the mayor councilmen and citizens of the city of liberty shall be vested in and expressed by a city council said city council to consist of one member from each ward and one at large to be elected by a general ticket by the registered qualified voters of said city of liberty on the first tuesday in april 191 and every two years thereafter amended by session acts 192  qualifications no person shall be a member of the city council unless he be a citizen of the state of missouri over the age of twentyone years and shall have resided within the city limits two years next preceding his election and be a bona fide resident of the ward for which he is elected and a registered qualified voter of said city amended by an act approved  session acts 186 p 219 effect of moving from ward if a councilman shall after his election remove from the ward from which he was chosen his office shall be thereby vacated president pro tempore the council in the absence of the mayor shall elect one of their number to be president pro tem of the council  and the president pro tem thus elected shall during the absence from the city of the mayor or a vacancy in the office or of the inability of the mayor to serve perform all duties of mayor elected officers at the annual election of members of the city council as aforesaid the registered qualified voters of said city shall elect a city attorney city treasurer city constable and a city clerk and auditor who shall respectively hold their offices until their successors are duly elected and qualified  and provided further that no person is eligible to any office within the city who is not a registered qualified voter of said city amended by session acts 192  judges of elections  contested elections the mayor and the city council shall be the judge of all election returns and qualifications of such mayor members of the city council and other city officers and shall determine contested elections quorum a majority of the city council shall constitute a quorum to do business  but a smaller number may meet and adjourn from day to day and may compel the attendance of absent members in such manner and under such penalties as the council may prescribe rules of procedure  expulsion of members the council may determine the rules of their proceedings punish their members for disorderly conduct and with the concurrence of twothirds of all the members elected expel a member but not the second time for the same offense journal the mayor and council shall keep a journal of their proceedings  and the yeas and nays of the members on any question shall at the desire of any member present be entered on the journal eligibility of mayor or councilmen for other office neither the mayor or any member of the council shall during the time for which he or they are elected be appointed to any office under the provisions of this act unless a petition to that effect be signed by the qualified voters of the city vacancies all vacancies that occur in the council shall be filled in such manner as shall be provided by ordinance affidavit as to residence every member of the council before entering upon the duties shall in addition to the oath of office hereinafter required make affidavit that it is his bona fide intention to reside within the ward for which he was elected during the term for which he was elected  and such oaths shall be in lieu of and shall dispense with an analogous provision hereinafter provided to other officers of the city in their oaths of office tie vote in election of mayor or councilmen whenever there shall be a tie in the election of members of the council the judges of election shall certify the same to the mayor or person exercising the duties of mayor who shall immediately thereupon issue his proclamation stating such facts and ordering a new election  and if such tie shall occur upon any election for mayor such judges of election shall certify same to the city council and such council after qualification shall elect between such candidates having an equal number of votes  and in the further event that neither of such candidates for mayor shall receive a majority of the votes of said council a new election for mayor shall be ordered by said city council within a period and upon notice to be prescribed by ordinance meetings there shall be stated meetings of the council once in every calendar month at such time and place as the council may designate and other and further meetings of said council may be convened by the mayor or the person in discharging the duties of mayor at any time in his discretion  provided always that said mayor and council may adjourn any meeting from day to day or to any time within said calendar month entering ayes and nays under certain conditions upon the passage of all and every bill appropriating money imposing taxes or increasing lessening or abolishing licenses or borrowing money the ayes and nays shall be entered upon the journals upon the motion of the mayor or any member of the council present majority vote required in certain cases a majority of all members of the council shall be necessary to pass any tax bills or bills appropriating any sum amounting to one hundred dollars or any other bill or bills involving the like amount in anywise increasing affecting or diminishing the city revenue article iii  legislative powers enumerated the city council shall have power within the city by ordinance 1stto levy and collect taxes not exceeding one and onequarter per centum per annum upon the assessed value of all property made taxable by law for state and other purposes and also to provide for the collection of the same by the sale of all real estate and personal estate within the city in such manner as this act or the council of said city by ordinance shall provide 2ndto borrow money upon the credit of the city upon the votes of twothirds of the members of the council 3rdto appropriate money and provide for the payment of the debts appropriations contracts liabilities and expenses of the city 4thto make regulations to guard against and prevent the introduction of contagious and infectious diseases into the city and to make quarantine laws for that purpose and enforce the same within five miles of the city 5thto establish hospitals employ physicians attendants and procure drugs and medicines and to make regulations for the government and care thereof 6thto make regulations to secure the general health of the inhabitants and to abate prevent and remove nuisances 7thto provide the city with water by digging wells making cisterns improving springs and creeks and erecting and providing pumps on the streets avenues and sidewalks within the boundaries of the city for the convenience of the inhabitants thereof 8thto create open abolish alter widen extend establish grade pave or otherwise improve and to clean macadamize and keep in repair all streets avenues lanes and alleys within the city with the express restriction that the council shall not establish or open any street lane avenue or alley property which has not been laid out by the owner or owners thereof in town lots and a plat thereof filed according to law unless by the written consent of the owners of such property provided always that the council may by ordinance require the owners of such property when laid out into lots or outlots to have the streets lanes avenues or alleys to correspond as nearly as may be with the streets lanes avenues or alleys in the city  and no such street lane avenue or alley shall be opened located or altered unless such city council shall pay the owner of such real estate such damages as may be found due such proprietor to be ascertained by a jury of twelve men or by any other provisions as the council may by ordinance prescribe or by other legal proceedings 9thto establish erect and keep in repair bridges culverts and sewers and to regulate the use of the same 10thto establish support and regulate the night watch and patrol 11thto erect market houses establish markets and market places and provide for the government of the same 12thto provide for the erection of all needful buildings for the use of the city 13thto provide for inclosing and improving any real estate belonging to the city 14thto license tax and regulate auctioneers grocers merchants retailers dramshop keepers ordinaries taverns druggists and apothecaries 15thto license tax regulate restrain and suppress hawkers peddlers shows theatricals and other performances and exhibitions 16thto license tax and suppress prohibit and restrain gaming and gambling houses keepers of billiard tables nine or tenpin alleys 17thto provide for the extinguishment of fires to organize and establish fire companies and to provide necessary and suitable engines hose buckets ladders firehooks and other apparatus  and also to regulate the erection of wooden buildings in any part of the city  to regulate and prevent the carrying on of any business pursuit or manufactory of a character to cause or produce fires or prejudicial or injurious to the health of the inhabitants and to compel the owners of houses and other buildings to have scuttles upon such houses or buildings and stairs or ladders leading to the same 18thto regulate and order the cleaning of chimneys and to fix the flues thereof  to regulate the storage of gunpowder tar rosin pitch hemp cotton and all other combustible materials and to regulate the use of lamps and lighted lamps and candles in all stables shops and other places  to remove or prevent the construction of any fireplace stone hearth chimney oven boiler kettle or apparatus used in any house building manufactory or business which may be adjudged dangerous in causing or promoting fires  to prohibit under suitable penalties the firing of firecrackers or other squibs and the discharging of fire arms  to direct the construction of deposits for ashes  and to enter into at reasonable hours or to appoint one or more officers at reasonable times to enter into and examine all outhouses lots yards enclosures and outbuildings of every description in order to see if such places or buildings are in a dangerous unhealthy or offensive state and to cause such as may be found by verdict of a jury to be dangerous unhealthy or offensive to put in a safe healthful and secure condition 19thto provide for the inspection and weighing of hay the storing and measuring of charcoal stonecoal firewood and other fuel to be used in the city 20thto regulate the inspection of butter lard and other provisions vending of meat poultry butter meat eggs and fruits and suppress huckstering within market hours 21stto provide for taking an enumeration of the inhabitants of the city 22ndto provide for the election of all elective city officers and provide for the removing from office any person holding an office created by this act or by ordinance not otherwise provided for 23rdto provide for the appointment of all officers servants and agents of the corporation not otherwise provided for  to fix the compensation of the city officers and regulate the fees of all jurors witnesses and others for services rendered under this act or any ordinance 24thto regulate the police of the city  to impose fines forfeitures and penalties for the breach of any ordinance  and to provide for the recovery and appropriating such fines and forfeitures and the enforcement of such penalties 25thto erect a work house and a house of correction and provide for the regulation and government thereof 26thto levy and collect a poll tax not to exceed two dollars upon every free male person over eighteen years of age who shall have resided six months within the city 27thto remove all obstructions from the sidewalks and provide for the construction grading paving and repairing of all sidewalks and for the cleaning of the same and of the gutters at the expense of the owners of the ground fronting thereon 28thto prevent and restrain any riot noise disturbance or disorderly assemblage in any street house or place in the city 29thto prevent and remove all obstructions in and upon all streets lanes avenues and alleys established by law or ordinance 30thto have and exercise complete and perfect control over any commons of the city and all the property belonging to the city real and personal whether lying in or beyond the limits of the corporation created by this act and the same to lease sell transfer and dispose of either absolutely or with limitation to any person or persons whatsoever 31stto make such general rules regulations bylaws and ordinances for the purpose of maintaining the peace good government and order of the city of liberty and the trade and manufactures thereof as the city council may deem expedient and for that purpose may make and enforce any ordinance or ordinances for the apprehension and holding in custody of all or any offenders against the laws of said city until the said offender or offenders can be brought to proper trial and may enforce the observance of all laws rules regulations bylaws and ordinances which may be passed by said city council under this act by inflicting penalties upon any person or persons for the violation of any ordinance or law 32ndto make all ordinances subject to the restrictions in the last preceding subdivision of this section specified which shall be necessary and proper for carrying into effect the powers vested by this act in the corporation the city government or any department or office thereof 33rdthat all taxation laws passed by the city council other than those applying to hucksters menageries circuses concerts theatricals exhibitions and similar amusements billiard table keepers and the retail trade in spirituous liquors whether the same is to be drunk at the place sold or not and whether the same is sold by grocer druggist merchant dramshop keeper hotel or tavern keeper shall be based upon the ad valorem principle and no other occupation business or pursuit other than those herein designated shall be taxed by such council but in lieu thereof the amount of capital employed in such business pursuit profession or occupation shall be taxed at the same rates that other property real and personal is taxed by law or ordinance 34thno money shall be drawn from the city treasury except in pursuit of an ordinance or resolution of the city council regularly passed at a regular or special meeting of the council 35thevery ordinance or resolution passed by the city council shall be signed by the mayor or president pro tem of the council and attested by the clerk of the city council before it shall have or take effect  provided however that if the mayor shall neglect or refuse to sign such resolution order or ordinance within two 2 months after it shall have been passed by the city council then the same is become as valid as if it had received the approval of the mayor and attestation of the city clerk  and in the event that the mayor shall veto any measure whatever passed by the city council the same may be passed over his veto by a vote of twothirds of the whole council 36ththe style of the ordinances of the city shall be be it ordained by the city council of the city of liberty 37thall ordinances passed by the city council within thirty 30 days after they become laws shall be published in pamphlet form or in some newspaper printed in the city of liberty in the discretion of the city council  but the failure to publish any ordinance within the time specified in this section shall not render void or affect the validity of any such ordinance unless such delay may cause such ordinance to act retrospectively on the rights of individuals 38thall ordinances of the city may be proved by the seal of the present city corporation and when such ordinance or ordinances have been published by authority of the corporation they shall be received as evidence in all courts and places without further proof approved 4285 bonded indebtedness not less than fourfifths of the taxes levied and collected annually upon the property of the inhabitants of said city shall constitute a special tax to be applied toward the payment of the bonded indebtedness of said city or the interest thereon and shall be paid in current funds or coupons of the bonds of said city passed due or maturing during the current fiscal year payment of current expenses the balance of the taxes so levied and collected and not applied to the payment of the bonded indebtedness of said city shall be applied to the payment of the current expenses of said city as the council thereof may direct amended by act approved  session acts 187 p 337 for additional powers of city of liberty see rsmo  et seq   et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  et seq  and  et seq article iv  executive and ministerial offices mayorelection  term of office the chief executive officer of the city shall be the mayor who shall be elected by the registered qualified voters of the city at each election for city officers and shall hold his office for two years and until his successor is elected and qualified  provided that any election to fill a vacancy shall only be for the remainder of the time for which his predecessor was elected amended by session acts of 192  samequalifications no person shall be mayor who at the time of his election is not possessed of the qualifications for a city councilman or who holds any lucrative office under the authority of the united states samecity council to decide election in certain cases if two or more persons shall have an equal number of votes for mayor or if the election shall be contested the city council elected for the same term shall decide the election by a vote samevacancy whenever a vacancy shall happen in the office of mayor it shall be filled by election in such time and manner as the city council by ordinance may provide sameremoval the mayor may be removed from office for any misdemeanor by a vote of twothirds of the whole council samepowers and duties the mayor shall act as president of the city council and shall have power to nominate and by and with the consent of the city council appoint all city officers not ordered by this act appointed or elected he shall take care that the ordinances of the city are duly enforced respected and observed within the city  he may remit fines punishments forfeitures and penalties accruing or imposed for the violation of any law or ordinance of said city by and with the consent of the city council  he may fill all vacancies which may occur in any elective office other than a member of the city council until the same be filled by election and in any other office until the end of the next session of the city council which may happen after the vacancy occurs  he shall from time to time give to the city council information relative to the state of the city and shall recommend to their consideration such measures as he shall deem expedient for the advantage of the city the mayor while presiding in the city council shall have no vote on any measure or question except there be a tie in which case he shall give the casting vote amended by an act approved  session acts 186 p 219 sameauthority to call special meetings the mayor may call special meetings of the council by proclamation or by written notice or by verbal notice to members of the council samesamepurpose to be stated whenever a special meeting of the council shall have been called by the mayor he shall state to them when assembled the cause for which they have been convened city recorder the city recorder shall be ex officio clerk of the city council and in addition to the duties imposed upon him by this act shall perform such other duties as recorder or clerk as the city council by ordinance may prescribe authority of city council to designate elective officers the city council may by ordinance provide for the election of officers of said city not herein made elective by the qualified voters of said city duties of clerk of city council it shall be the duty of the clerk of the city council to keep a journal of the proceedings of the council  to record in a separate book all ordinances or resolutions appropriating money  to keep a record of all the official acts of the mayor and when necessary to attest the same he shall keep and preserve in his office the common seal of the city and all records public papers and documents not properly belonging to any other office duties of city treasurer it shall be the duty of the city treasurer to receive and keep the money of the city and to pay out the same on warrants drawn by the mayor or other officer authorized by ordinance to draw them  and to perform such other duties as the council prescribe city constable the city constable shall within the city possess the same powers perform the same duties and receive the same fees and compensation as the constable of liberty township for similar services he shall execute and return all process to him directed whether issued by the mayor recorder or any member of the city council or by any justice of the peace where such justice is authorized to issue process under this act or any ordinance of the city he shall also be ex officio collector of the city taxes he shall attend each meeting of the city council and perform such services as the council may require of him he shall have power to arrest all offenders against the law or any ordinance of the city and secure or hold in custody the same until he she or they can be brought to proper trial mayor etc to reside in city the mayor and all other officers of the city shall reside within the city limits during their continuance in office city recorder the recorder of the city shall be a resident of the city and shall possess the same qualifications as mayor of the city and the city council and shall hold his office one year and until his successor is duly elected and qualified such recorder shall be removed from the office in the same manner as the mayor he shall have the same jurisdiction as justices of the peace he shall have exclusive jurisdiction over all cases arising under any ordinance of the city  subject however in all cases to an appeal to the circuit court of clay county  and every such appeal shall be granted as in this act expressed he shall have power to take and certify under the sale of the city the acknowledgment of deeds conveyances and all other instruments of writing requiring authentication he shall be authorized to administer oaths or affirmations and take depositions  and such deeds conveyances and all other instruments may be recorded in any county in this state and may be read in any court or place of this state as evidence without further authentication he shall be entitled in all cases to the same fees which are now or may be hereafter allowed to justices of the peace for similar services which shall be taxed and collected as other costs by fee bill or execution city attorney the city attorney shall have resided six months within the city next prior to his election and shall be a licensed lawyer admitted to practice at the bar of the clay county circuit court he shall at all times give legal advice to any officer of the city shall prescribe the forms of deeds and other instruments of writing in which the city is interested or a party and shall perform such other duties as the city council may by ordinance direct and prescribe absence etc of city recorder in the event of the absence sickness removal or other inability of the recorder to act any justice of the peace residing within the limits of the city shall have power to issue all process in and to hear try and determine all cases properly recognizable before the recorder  and if no justice of the peace resides within the city then any justice of the peace within and for liberty township shall be possessed with the same powers herein granted to justices residing in said city article v  elections when held a general election of all the officers of the corporation required to be elected by this act or by any ordinance of the city shall be holden on the first monday of april in each year unless otherwise provided by ordinance manner of conducting generally at all elections for city officers the voters shall vote by ballot and the manner and place of holding such elections shall be regulated by ordinance of the city subject to the registration and election laws of the state amended by act approved  session acts 186 at p 219 judges three judges of election who shall be registered qualified voters and two clerks shall be appointed by the city council unless otherwise provided for by the registration law of the state of missouri and they shall take an oath or affirmation to faithfully discharge their duties according to law as judges and clerks aforesaid they shall open their poll books at nine oclock in the morning and keep them open until six oclock in the afternoon when they shall close the same and proceed forthwith to ascertain and certify the result of the election in the presence of so many candidates or other persons who may deem proper to be present  provided there shall not be less than three others present at any count amended by act approved  session acts 186 at p 219 holding elections in grogshop etc prohibited no election shall be held in a grogshop or other place where intoxicating liquors are vended qualifications of voters all qualified voters of the state of missouri who shall have resided within the city sixty days next preceding any election shall be qualified voters at said election amended by  see also rsmo  opening and closing polls etc elections for city officers shall not be continued for longer than one day and during that day the polls shall not be closed longer than two hours between the time of opening and closing the same finally special elections special elections shall be held under such regulations as may be provided by ordinance article vi  opening and widening streets grading etc streets it shall not be lawful for the city council to grade pave or macadamize any street lane or avenue not opened or established according to law it shall be lawful nevertheless for the city council to order the owners of ground fronting on any private alley to keep the same clean and if necessary thereto to direct him to pave the same eminent domaingenerally when it is necessary to take private property for opening widening altering or extending any public street lane or avenue the corporation shall make a just compensation therefor to the person whose property is so taken  and if the amount of such compensation cannot be agreed upon the recorder shall cause the same to be ascertained by twelve disinterested freeholders of the city sameascertainment of benefits in opening altering widening extending alleys or squares of the city the same proceedings shall be had in case of opening widening altering or extending public streets lanes or avenues with the addition that the jury will ascertain the amount of benefit that will accrue to the person whose property is so taken and those who may have petitioned for the opening widening etc of such alleys petition by abutting property owners to open etc streets etc when the owners of the major part of the front of all property on the street lane avenue or alley proposed to be opened widened or extended shall petition therefor the mayor and city council may open widen alter or extend such street lane avenue or alley upon conditions to be prescribed by ordinance but no compensation shall be in such case made to those whose property shall be taken for opening widening altering or extending such street lane avenue or alley who have petitioned for the same  nor shall there be any assessment of benefit or damages that may accrue thereby to any of the petitioners jurors to establish damages etc in eminent domain proceedingsgenerally all jurors empaneled to inquire into the amount of benefit or damage which shall happen to any owner of property proposed to be taken for opening widening altering or extending any street lane avenue or alley shall first be sworn to that effect and shall return to the mayor their inquest in writing signed by each juror sameauthority of mayor to set aside etc the mayor shall have power for good cause shown within ten days after any inquest shall have been returned to him as mentioned in the preceding section to set the same aside and cause new inquest to be made sameauthority of mayor etc to enforce payment for benefits the mayor and city council shall have power by ordinance to enforce the payment of all sums which a jury shall declare to be the amount of benefit accruing to the owners of the property upon any alley which shall be opened widened altered or extended if the owner be one of the petitioners for opening widening altering or extending such alley special tax for paving etc the mayor and city council shall have power by ordinance to levy and collect a special tax of the holders of any lots on any street lane avenue or alley according to the respective fronts owned by them for the purpose of paving or grading such street lane avenue or alley provided always said tax shall not exceed one per centum  nor shall the grading or paving be done at the expense of the owners of the lots fronting on the street lane avenue or alley unless a petition for such grading and paving signed by the owners of the major part of the ground fronting thereon be presented for such purpose redemption of property sold for taxes the city council shall have power by ordinance to direct the manner in which any property real or personal advertised for sale or sold for taxes general or special or for the cost of any improvement done or ordered to be done by authority of the corporation may be redeemed assessment of open etc land lands within the limits of the city which have not been laid off into blocks or lots shall not be taxed or assessed otherwise than by the acre as agricultural or waste land and shall continue to be so taxed or assessed until laid off into blocks or lots by the owners thereof respectively and the owners of such lands in laying off the same into blocks or lots shall so arrange the streets that they shall correspond with previously established streets of the city lot etc owners to keep street etc clean the city council shall have power by ordinance to compel all occupants of house or houses fronting on any street lane or avenue to keep the part of the street lane or avenue immediately in front of their houses clean of all trash and rubbish  and where the street lane or avenue immediately in front of any house is macadamized or paved to keep the same clear of all mud or dirt article vii  miscellaneous provisions annual financial statement the city council shall cause to be published at the end of each fiscal year a full complete and detailed statement of all moneys received and expended by the corporation during the preceding fiscal year and what account received and expended classifying each receipt and expenditure under its appropriate head effect of prior ordinances etc all ordinances and resolutions now in force in the city of liberty previous to the passage of this act and not inconsistent with this act shall remain in full force until altered modified or repealed by the city council under the provisions of this act and all officers elected in pursuance of any law or ordinance of the corporation of the city of liberty previous to the passage of this act and now in office shall so remain in office until the time for which they were elected expires style of law suits all suits actions and prosecutions instituted commenced or brought by the corporation hereby created shall be instituted commenced and prosecuted in the name of mayor councilmen and citizens of the city of liberty rights of prior corporation all actions fines taxes penalties and forfeitures which have accrued to the corporation or the mayor councilmen and citizens of the city of liberty under their corporation previous to the passage of this act and the ordinances or bylaws of said corporation for the receiving of which no suit or action at law shall have been commenced or instituted shall be and the same is hereby vested and may be prosecuted for by the corporation hereby created status of law suits instituted by prior corporation all suits or action at law for the recovery of any fines taxes penalties or forfeitures arising under the present corporation of the city of liberty or under any ordinance law or bylaws thereof instituted or pending in any court in the name of the mayor councilmen and citizens of the city of liberty and not prosecuted to final judgment shall not thereby abate or be discontinued in consequence of the passage of this act but the same shall be in everywise proceeded with by the corporation hereby created in such manner with same power as the corporation hereby repealed property etc of prior corporation all property real personal and mixed and choses in action heretofore belonging to the city of liberty or to the mayor councilmen and citizens of said city in their corporate capacity shall be and the same is hereby declared to be vested in the corporation hereby created obligations of prior corporation all debts obligations and contracts due from entered into or incurred by the present corporation of the city of liberty or the mayor councilmen and citizens thereof in their corporate capacity shall be fully paid satisfied and fulfilled by the corporation hereby created as fully to all intents and purposes as the said corporation hereby repealed and are liable for and bound to discharge the same prior acts etc this charter shall not invalidate any act or acts done by the present corporation of the city of liberty or any officer thereof nor divest them of any right that may have accrued to them prior to the passage of this act repealed by act approved  session acts 186 at p 219 charter as a public act this act is hereby declared to be a public act and may be read in evidence in all courts of law or equity in this state without further proof persons exempted from road work etc all persons living within the limits of the city of liberty are hereby exempted from working upon any road without and beyond the boundaries of said city and from paying any fine or penalty to be applied to employ any laborers or furnish means or provide materials to work or be used upon any road beyond the limits of said city general penalty any person who shall fail neglect or refuse to pay any fine or cost imposed by judgment of the municipal court upon conviction of misdemeanor or of any installment thereof shall be proceeded against in like manner and be subject to orders of court in the same manner as is provided by the laws of the state of missouri with respect of such default for a fine is imposed upon conviction of a misdemeanor under the laws of the state of missouri relating to offenses against the peace and dignity of the state including enforcement of payment and collection authorized by state law with respect to state offenses constituting misdemeanors approved 4285 misdemeanors the city council shall by ordinance prescribe in what a misdemeanor in said city of liberty shall consist or what shall constitute the same fiscal year the fiscal year of the city shall terminate on the day redemption of property sold for taxes whenever any real estate shall have been advertised for sale or shall have been sold for the payment of any fine judgment penalty forfeiture or taxes in the same by paying to the purchaser thereof the full amount of said purchase money and all taxes subsequently paid thereon together with all cost and the full value of any useful or necessary improvement made thereon by such purchaser to be assessed by a jury of twelve 12 householders before the recorder of said city together with one hundred 100 per centum on the original amount of liberty or by metes and bounds thereof and briefly describing the judgment penalty forfeiture tax or improvement for the nonpayment of which the same was sold together with the date of each sale session of the city council and upon said council or a majority of them be satisfied by the affidavit of such purchaser or otherwise that the said owner has failed to redeem the real estate therein described within two 2 years after the sale of such real estate and the date of such certificate such purchaser shall receive a deed of conveyance from the said corporation conveying to such purchaser the real estate described in such certificate samedeed of conveyance the deed of conveyance above described shall be made and executed by the mayor of the city of liberty in the name of said city and shall recite the judgment penalty forfeiture or neglected improvement together with the law and ordinance under which the same was sold  the advertisement for sale and the time place and terms of sale conveyance so executed and acknowledged shall vest in such purchaser all the right title and interest estate and property of the previous owners of such real estate and shall be admitted in evidence in any court within this state in any suit or action at law or in equity as evidence of title without further proof right of heirs etc to redeem property sold for taxes etc the owners of any real estate sold under the provisions of this act or his widow executor administrator or heirs may within any time within two 2 years after such sale redeem the same in and after the same manner in which the owner had he lived might redeem the same  and upon said payment shall receive from said council attested by mayor or under the seal of said city a quietus to the title thereto conforming as near as may be to the quietus granted by the state of missouri under analogous circumstances  and such quietus shall fully vest all the title to such real estate in the original owners disposition of surplus money from sale of real estate for taxes etc all surplus money received by the corporation hereby created arising from the sale of any real estate over and above the amount due for taxes penalties forfeitures fines judgments and costs shall be paid into the city treasury  and the owner of such real estate at the time of such sale or his legal representatives may apply to the city council for such surplus who shall issue a warrant on the city treasurer in favor of the owner of such real estate at the time of such sale or his representatives for such amount paid into the treasury for his use prosecutions for misdemeanors all prosecutions for misdemeanors shall be instituted before the recorder or other officer having jurisdiction thereof as is in this act herein challenges punishment for misdemeanor all persons charged with and convicted of a misdemeanor for violation of a city ordinance shall be punished as provided by ordinance but not to exceed a fine of misdemeanorsgenerally that all charges of misdemeanors and all statements of cause of action occurring under any law ordinance or bylaw of the city of liberty inflicting any fine penalty forfeiture or tax shall be filed before the recorder or other officer having jurisdiction under this act before the said officer or officers can hear adjudge and determine the same and such charge or statement shall describe such course of action and the particular law ordinance or bylaw under which the same occurred in plain and intelligible language expressed in writing and signed by the city attorney in such manner as to render the same a clear and perfect statement of the cause of action sameprocedure for arrest etc upon filing the statement of the cause of action hereinbefore provided the officer misdemeanor or other offense against the laws of the city  but when such warrant is incorporated in said charge or statement the same shall be attested by the city attorney and signed by the recorder or other officer having jurisdiction of same with the common seal of the city affixed thereto samesameprerequisites to fair trial when such warrant is served on any person or persons charged with any misdemeanor or other offense against the city such person or persons so served shall have time given them by the officer before whom they are brought to procure counsel witnesses and other things requisite for a fair and impartial trial samesamewitnesses in all trials before the recorder or other officer having jurisdiction arising under this act such officer shall have as full and as perfect power in the subpoenaing of witnesses and compelling the attendance thereof and inflicting penalties for the refusal of any witnesses to attend a trial when subpoenaed as any court of law or equity in this state is possessed of  and the mode and manner of subpoenaing witnesses by such officer shall be regulated by ordinance of the city council samesamecontinuance no suit instituted before the recorder or other officer for the recovery of any fine tax penalty or forfeiture for the breach of any city law bylaw or city ordinance shall be continued by such recorder or other officer even upon good cause shown for a longer time than two days at any one time  continuances shall be at the cost of the party applying therefor unless otherwise ordered by the officer granting the same holding certain suits under advisement no suit or action for the recovery of any fine tax forfeiture or penalty arising under this act shall after the hearing of the same be held under advisement by any officer before whom the same is tried for a longer time than one hour time within which appeals to be taken etc all appeals from the verdict of any jury or rendition of any judgment by and before the recorder or other officer under this act shall be taken by plaintiff or defendant within ten days after such finding or judgment  and the affidavit and bond and other matters connected with such appeal shall conform in all respects as near as may be to the laws of this state regulating appeals from judgments rendered by justices of the peace to the circuit court proceedings before recordergenerally the practice and proceedings before the recorder under this act for the recovery of any fine tax forfeiture or penalty for the breach of any bylaw or ordinance of the city unless when otherwise expressly provided shall conform in all respects as near as may be to the laws of this state regulating justices courts sameimprisonment in all cases where a judgment shall be rendered upon the verdict or finding of a jury and such verdict finding or judgment or any part thereof involves the imprisonment of the defendant it shall be the duty of said recorder or other officer to defendant shall from the making of such order or the issue of such commitment remain in safe custody unless discharged by the taking of an appeal as hereinbefore provided or discharged by due course of law execution of orders etc within county the city constable or other officer entrusted with the execution of any command power or trust under this act shall execute such command power or trust in any part of clay county qualifications of jurors in selecting jurors to try any case arising under this act it shall be lawful to select any person or persons qualified to act as jurors under the laws council shall mean the city council of liberty computation of time the time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first and including the last day  and if the last day is sunday or a legal holiday that shall be excluded state law reference see rsmo  county the words the county shall mean the county of clay state of missouri gender when any subject matter party or law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed owner the word owner applied to a building or land shall include any part owner joint owner tenant in common joint tenant or tenant by the entirety of the whole or a part of such building or land person the word person shall include a corporation firm partnership association organization and any other group acting as a unit as well as individuals it shall also include an executor administrator trustee receiver or other representative appointed according to law whenever the word person is used in any section of this a penalty or fine as to partnerships or associations the word shall include the partners or members thereof and as to corporations shall include the officers agents or members thereof who are responsible for any violation of such section state law reference see rsmo 11 preceding following the words preceding and following shall mean next before and next after respectively state law reference see rsmo 14 property the word property shall include real and tangible and intangible personal property state law reference see rsmo 15 public way the words public way shall include any street alley boulevard parkway highway sidewalk or other public thoroughfare real property the terms real property premises real estate or lands shall be deemed to be coextensive with lands tenements and hereditaments state law reference see rsmo 16 shall may the word shall is mandatory and the word may is permissive sidewalk the word sidewalk shall mean that portion of the street between the curb line and the adjacent property line which is intended for the use of pedestrians including sidewalks over private property where curb line and property line are the same signature where the written signature of any person is required the proper handwriting of such person or his mark shall be intended state the words the such words shall include all of them tangible personal property tangible personal property shall include goods chattels and all personal property except intangible personal property state law
