article i  in general city seal established there shall be a common seal of the city description of the seal the device of the common seal shall be a representation of the goddess of liberty standing upon a rock and holding in her right hand a staff supporting a cap with a scroll of parchment in her left hand partly unrolled whereon is inscribed the word liberty in roman capitals  and encircled around the device with the following words in roman capitals city of liberty missouri which seal shall be circular and not to exceed two inches in diameter seal kept by city clerk the city clerk shall be the keeper of the common seal of the city and custodian of said seal affixing seal the common seal shall be affixed to all the official certificates or documents of the city of liberty required by this   city limits a showing of the limits of the city shall be maintained on an uptodate map located in the department of community development article ii  city officers city council number of members there shall be elected two 2 council members from each ward in the city who shall hold office for a term of four 4 years  provided that at the general city election on  there shall be elected one council member from each ward who shall serve for a term of four 4 years and at the next city general election on  there shall be elected one council member from each ward who shall serve for a term of one year after which election there shall be elected at each succeeding general city election for municipal officers one council member from each ward who shall serve for a term of four 4 years council regular meetings a time the city council shall hold regular meetings on the second and fourth mondays of each month at  pm  provided however that when the day fixed for any regular meeting of the council falls upon a day designated by law as a legal or national holiday such meeting shall be held at the same hour on the next succeeding day not a holiday unless otherwise provided by the council b place all regular meetings of the council shall be held in the council chamber of the city hall unless otherwise designated by the mayor and city council council special meetings the mayor shall call special meetings of the council whenever in his opinion the public business may require it by proclamation or verbal or written notice to all members of the council at least twentyfour 24 hours in advance of a scheduled special meeting with publication of said notice to appear in at least one newspaper of general distribution within the city of liberty adjourned meetings of council any meeting of the city council may be continued or adjourned from day to day or for more than one day but such adjourned meeting must be reconvened prior to the next regular scheduled meeting thereafter council agenda the city administrator shall be responsible for the preparation of the agenda and it should be delivered to the mayor and council at least fortyeight 48 hours prior to each council meeting presiding officer of council the mayor shall act as presiding officer of the city council the presiding officer shall preserve strict order and decorum at regular and special meetings of the council he shall state every question coming before the council announce the decision of the council on all subjects and decide all questions of order and procedure unless overruled by a twothirds majority vote of the council in the event of the absence of the mayor the president pro tem of the council shall preside at city council meetings call to order of council the presiding officer shall take the chair at the hour appointed for the meeting and shall call the council to order roll call of council before proceeding with the business of the council the city clerk or deputy shall call the roll of members and the names of those present shall be entered in the minutes council quorum a majority of the members of the council shall constitute a quorum at any regular or special meeting of the council no action shall be valid unless a majority in attendance shall vote in favor of such action except as may be provided in other ordinances requiring a larger favorable vote for adoption council order of business meetings of the council shall be open to the public except for executive sessions as authorized by state statute the order of business shall be as follows 1 call to order 2 invocation 3 roll call 4 approval of minutes of previous meetings 5 citizens participation 6 swearingin ceremony if any 7 meeting schedule 8 consent agenda 9 public hearings if any 10 ordinances contracts and resolutions 11 other business 12 miscellaneous matters from city administrator 13 miscellaneous matters from mayor and city council 14 adjournment  61388 reading of council minutes unless a reading of the minutes of a council meeting is requested by a member of the council such minutes may be approved without reading if the members of the council have been previously furnished with a copy thereof council rules of debate a getting the floor every member desiring to speak shall address the chair and upon recognition by the presiding officer shall confine himself to the question under debate b interruptions a member once recognized shall not be interrupted when speaking unless it be to call him to order by the presiding officer or as herein otherwise provided if a member while speaking be called to order he shall cease speaking until the question of order be determined and if in order he shall be permitted to proceed c motion to reconsider a motion to reconsider any action taken by the council shall be made either immediately during the same session or at a recessed or adjourned session thereof such motion must be made by one of prevailing side but may be seconded by any member and may be made at any time and have precedence over all other motions or while a member has the floor  it shall be debatable d request for remarks to be entered in minutes a council member may request of the presiding officer the privilege of having an abstract of his statement on any subject entered into the minutes e entering synopsis of debate in minutes the city clerk may be directed by the presiding officer to enter in the minutes a synopsis of the discussion on any question coming regularly before the council addressing the council any person desiring to address the council shall first secure the permission of the presiding officer  provided however unless the mayor rules otherwise persons shall address the council only when the order of business moves to 1 citizens participation for matters not shown on the published agenda  and 2 any item shown on the published agenda which is applicable to their purpose for wishing to address the council preference shall be given to persons who have notified the deputy city clerk in advance of their desire to address the council manner of addressing the council  time limit each person addressing the council shall approach the podium give his name and address in an audible tone of voice for the record and shall limit his address to an announced time limit no person other than the mayor and council and the person having the floor shall be permitted to enter into any discussion either directly or member of the council without the permission of the presiding officer provided that a majority vote of the council may overrule the presiding officer abstaining from voting unless a member of the council states that he is abstaining his failure to vote shall be recorded as a vote with the majority any member of the council shall abstain from voting due to a stated conflict of interest council decorum a responsibility of council members while the council is in session the members must preserve order and decorum and a member shall neither by conversation or otherwise delay or interrupt the proceedings or the peace of the council nor disturb any member while speaking or refuse to obey the orders of the council or presiding officer except as otherwise herein provided b persons addressing the council any person making personal impertinent or slanderous remarks or who shall become boisterous while addressing the council shall forthwith by the presiding officer or by a majority vote of the council be barred from further audience before the council unless permission to continue be granted by a majority vote of the council enforcement of council decorum the presiding officer may designate a sergeantatarms of the council meetings who shall carry out all orders and instructions given by the presiding officer or enacted by a majority vote of the council for the purpose of maintaining order and decorum at the council meetings council members protests against council action any council member shall have the right to have the reasons for his dissent from or protest against any action of the council entered on the minutes ordinances resolutions motions and contracts a every motion resolution and ordinance shall be reduced to writing before the vote is taken thereon and upon consideration of passage of every ordinance appropriating money imposing taxes or increasing lessening or abolishing licenses or borrowing money the ayes and nays shall be called and recorded b introducing for passage or approval 1 ordinances resolutions and other matters or subjects requiring action by the council must be introduced and sponsored by the mayor or a member of the council except that the city administrator may present ordinances resolutions and other matters or subjects to the council and any council member may assume sponsorship thereof by moving that such ordinances resolutions matters subjects be adopted  otherwise they shall not be considered 2 all proposed ordinances shall be given a document number by the city clerk and shall be adopted by reference to the document number and an ordinance number 3 all ordinances except ordinances relating to appropriations shall be presented at two 2 separate city council meetings before being adopted by the city council  provided that such provision may be waived by the unanimous consent of all council members present at any meeting ordinances not relating to appropriations or considered on first reading shall be passed to second reading 4 the style of ordinances shall be be it ordained by the city council of the city of liberty missouri as follows 5 the city clerk shall note the passage and effect of any ordinance on prior ordinances modified amended or repealed i 5905 council reports ordinances and resolutions filed with city clerk all reports ordinances and resolutions shall be filed with the city clerk and entered on the minutes adjournment of council a motion to adjourn shall always be in order and decided without debate affidavits by council members prerequisite to office the members of the city council in addition to the affidavit required by the charter of the city shall before entering upon the duties of their offices respectively make affidavits under oath that they will support the constitutions of the united states and of the state of missouri and that they will to the best of their skill and ability diligently and faithfully without partiality or prejudice discharge the duties of their offices according to the constitution and laws of said state affidavits by ministerial officers other than council members all ministerial officers of the city other than members of the city council before entering upon the duties of their respective offices shall respectively make affidavit under oath that they will support the constitutions of the united states and of the state of missouri and that they will to the best of their skill and ability diligently and faithfully without partiality or prejudice discharge the duties of their offices according to the constitution and laws of this state  and that it is their bona fide intention to reside within the city for the term of office for which they are elected or appointed ethics a mission statement the proper operation of a democratic government requires that public officers be independent impartial and responsible to the people  that government decisions and policy be made within the proper channels of governmental structure  that public office not be used for personal gain  and that the public have confidence in the integrity of its government in recognition of these goals a code of ethics for all public officers is hereby adopted the purpose of this code is to establish guidelines for ethical standards of conduct for all public officers of the city by setting forth those acts or actions that are not reasonably compatible with the best interests of the city and by directing disclosure by such public officers of interest in matters affecting the city b definitions 1 business entity means any corporation limited liability company general or limited partnership sole proprietorship including a private consulting firm person entity or operation joint venture unincorporated association or firm institution trust any combination of individuals andor artificial entities foundation or other organization whether or not organized for profit 2 confidential information means all information which is i specifically identified and termed as being confidential ii communicated orally or in writing and iii of such a nature that it is not at the time of such communication a matter of public record or public knowledge for purposes of this section the phrase public record shall be deemed to refer to all written information documents and other matter to which the public has a right of access under the missouri sunshine law rsmo  et seq or under any other state or federal statutes pertaining to open records and the phrase public knowledge shall refer to information which is reasonably available to members of the public 3 gift means any item or thing which has a reasonable value exceeding fifty dollars $5000 and which is given or received without the substantially contemporaneous exchange of an item or thing of reasonably equivalent value the term shall not include the solicitation acceptance receipt or regulation of political campaign contributions regulated in accordance with provisions of federal state or local laws governing campaign finances provided however for the purpose of this section the term gift as contained in this section shall not be interpreted to mean a a nonpecuniary award publicly presented to a public officer in recognition of public educational charitable or religious service or b gifts to public officers from their family members 4 interest means direct or indirect pecuniary or material benefit accruing to a public officer as a result of a contract transaction zoning decision or other matter which is or may be the subject of an official act or action by or with the city except for such contracts transactions zoning decisions or other matters which by their terms and by the substance of their provisions confer the opportunity and right to realize the accrual of similar benefits to all other persons andor property similarly situated for the purpose of this section an interest in a matter shall be attributed to the public officer if the interest in the matter is held by a the public officers spouse or dependent children  b any business entity with whom the public officer shall have a substantial contractual relationship  c any business entity in which the public officer is an officer director member partner agent trustee manager fiduciary or employee  and d any business entity in which the public officer controls or owns directly or indirectly 1 more than five 5 percent of the legal or beneficial ownership  or 2 an interest having a reasonable value equal to or exceeding fifty thousand dollars $5000000 5 official act or action means any legislative administrative appointive or discretionary act of any officer of the city or any agency board committee or commission thereof 6 public officer means any person holding a position by election or appointment in the service of the municipality whether paid or unpaid and a member of any board committee or commission thereof the phrase shall include by way of illustration and not of limitation the mayor members of the city council auditor treasurer constable city clerk all members of all boards and commissions members of ad hoc task forces and committees municipal judge city attorney prosecutor however and notwithstanding any provisions of this section to the contrary the phrase public officer shall not include or be applicable to fulltime paid employees of the city 7 substantial contractual relationship means a contractual relationship either orally or in writing in which the public officer will or reasonably expects to receive financial benefits equal to or exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 in any calendar year provided however a commercially reasonable loan made to a public officer in the ordinary course of business by an institution which is authorized by the laws of this state or of the united states to engage in the making of such loans shall not be deemed to create an interest in violation of this ordinance and provided further a reasonable commercial contractual obligation even though greater in value than five hundred dollars $50000 shall not be deemed to create an interest in violation of this section c conflicts of interest 1 interest in contract transaction zoning decision or other matter no public officer having the power or duty to perform an official act or action related to a particular contract transaction zoning decision or other matter which is or may be the subject of an official act or action of the city shall a participate in or attempt to influence either directly or indirectly any official act or action in relation to such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter in which he or she has any interest except as otherwise stated in this section  or b take any official act or action on any matter relating to a business entity in which the public officer shall have an interest  or c represent advise or appear on behalf of whether paid or unpaid any person involved in any such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter except as otherwise stated in this section  or d have solicited accepted or granted a gift from or to a person involved in such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter except as otherwise stated in this section 2 appearances no public officer shall appear on behalf of any private person or business entity other than for himself or herself or for his or her spouse or for his or her minor children before any city agency or municipal court a provided however a member of the city council may without compensation except where compensation is provided by the city to all council members similarly situated appear before city agencies on behalf of his or her constituents in the course of performing his or her duties as a representative of the electorate or in performing his or her public or civil obligations  b provided further no provision hereof shall preclude a public officer from making an appearance before any city agency in representation of a business entity in which such public officer has a substantial ownership interest so long as the public officer discloses to the city agency his or her ownership interest in the business entity at the inception of such appearance  c provided further no provision hereof shall preclude a public officer from making an appearance before any city agency in representation of a notforprofit entity or association in which such public officer is an officer or board member so long as the public officer discloses to the city agency his or her relationship to the notforprofit entity at the inception of such appearance  d provided further no public officer shall take any official act or action on any matter on which he has made an appearance as permitted above except as to members of the city council in acting in their official capacity as permitted in subsection c2a hereinabove 3 disclosure of interest in legislative action any public officer who has an interest in any proposed legislation before the council shall disclose the nature and extent of such interest on the public record in addition such public officer shall fully comply with the personal financial disclosure requirements as adopted by the city 4 public contracts notwithstanding the prohibitions in subsection c1 hereinabove a public officer may enter into a contract with the city if a the contract is awarded process of public notice and competitive bidding and b the contract is with a division or agency over which the public officer has no functions requiring the exercise of discretion 5 disclosure of confidential information no public officer with respect to any contract transaction zoning decision or other matter which is or may be the subject of an official act or action of the city shall without proper legal authorization disclose confidential information concerning the property government or affairs of the city or use such information to directly or indirectly advance the financial or other private interest of the public officer 6 public property elective and appointive officers shall not use cityowned vehicles equipment materials or property for personal convenience or profit except when such services are available to the public generally or are provided as municipal policy for the use of officials in the conduct of official business 7 special treatment no elective or appointive officer acting in his or her official capacity shall grant a special consideration treatment or advantage to any citizen beyond that which is reasonably available to other citizens similarly situated provided however no provision hereof shall be deemed to prohibit members of the council from addressing and seeking to redress grievances of their constituents as part of their essential legislative function 8 canvassing elected public officers a no person shall wilfully canvass any member of the city council directly or indirectly in order to obtain preferential consideration for employment in the municipal service any person who shall so canvass one or more council members for such preferential consideration shall upon determination that such prohibited canvassing has occurred be thenceforth disqualified from consideration for employment b elected public officers shall not recommend any individual for city employment promotion in city employment or release from city employment except where such recommendation is a part of the elected public officers official function or except where otherwise permitted by this code 9 later case interest no public officer shall for a period of one year after the termination of service with the city appear before any board commission committee or agency of the city in relation to any case proceeding or application or contract in which he or she personally participated during the period of his or her service or which was under his or her active consideration d board of ethics 1 creation of board there is hereby created and established a board of ethics board which shall consist of five 5 residents of the city to be appointed by the mayor with the advice and consent of the city council a the board shall elect one of its number who shall serve as chairperson b the members of the board shall serve without compensation c the term of each member of the board shall be for five 5 years provided however the terms of the initial members of the board shall be staggered for terms of one two 2 three 3 four 4 and five 5 years respectively d a quorum of the board shall be three 3 members e the vote of a majority of a quorum shall be deemed the official act of the board f meetings of the board may be called by the chairperson or by any two 2 members and not less than seven 7 days advance notice of a meeting shall be given to each of the members with respect to any such meeting provided however attendance of such meeting by a member shall be a waiver of the requirement that such member be given notice of same g in addition to seeking the advice of the city counselor as hereinafter provided the board may retain independent legal counsel to assist and advise the board regarding rendition of advisory opinions interpretation of this section investigation of alleged violations of this section and the applicability of this section to any factual pattern 2 duties of board the duties of the board shall be to generally a investigate violations of this section as hereinafter provided  and b to render advisory opinions as hereinafter provided 3 advisory opinions the board shall have the power to render advisory opinions with respect to this section and its application to specific factual patterns a advisory opinions shall be requested by formal written request of a public officer in such form and format as the board shall reasonably prescribe from time to time the requesting public officer shall have the opportunity to present his or her interpretation of the facts at issue and of the applicability of provisions of this ordinance prior to rendition of the advisory opinion which has been requested notwithstanding the foregoing the board shall have the power to issue advisory opinions upon its own initiative and without formal request by any public officer b prior to rendering an advisory opinion the board may seek the advice and assistance of the city counselor c an advisory opinion until amended or revoked shall be binding upon the city the city council and the board in any subsequent action or matter concerning the public officer who solicited such advisory opinion and who acted thereon in good faith provided however such advisory opinion shall not have such binding effect in the event any material facts upon which the advisory opinion was predicated were untrue omitted or misstated d an advisory opinion of the board shall be deemed a public record which shall be available for inspection by the public provided however 1 the name of the public officer requesting the advisory opinion as well as the names of any person or business entity mentioned in the advisory opinion shall be deemed confidential information and shall not be disclosed by the board unless the public officer waives such confidentiality or unless the board determines that the public officer requesting the advisory opinion has failed to act in good faith in requesting same or has failed to act in conformity with the advisory opinion or unless the identity of the person requesting or persons affected or to be affected by the advisory opinion is required to be disclosed by law 2 if the board shall seek advice from the city counselor prior to rendition of an advisory opinion the board may at its option disclose to the city counselor the identity of the public officer requesting the advisory opinion and may at its option disclose to the city counselor the names of any person or business entity who or which may be ultimately mentioned in the advisory opinion e in order to prevent undue delay in the governance of city government the board shall promptly consider and issue advisory opinions as requested by public officers 4 investigation of violations the board shall have the general power to investigate any alleged violation of this section and all public officers shall fully cooperate with any such investigations any person who believes that any public officer has violated any provision of this section shall have the right to file a complaint with the board which complaint shall be in such form and of such content as the board shall prescribe the board shall upon conclusion of its investigation report its findings and recommendations to the city council the board may retain independent legal counsel to assist and advise the city council regarding interpretation of this section and the operation andor effect of this section to any factual pattern e consequence of violations 1 if the board shall determine that any contract transaction zoning decision or other matter directly or indirectly resulted from an act or action in violation of this section the city council may at its option void reverse or nullify such resulting contract transaction zoning decision or other matter 2 if the board shall determine that any contract transaction zoning decision or other matter directly or indirectly resulted from an act or action in violation of this section the city council may at its option and after considering the interests of the city as well as the interests of third parties who have in good faith relied upon the validity of such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter bring a civil action at law or in equity for a judgment enjoining any violation of the provisions of this section or requiring relinquishing of any prohibited interest or voiding of any such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter if the city council after considering the interests of the city as well as the interests of third parties who have in good faith relied upon the validity of such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter shall not seek to invalidate such contract transaction zoning decision or other matter the city council may notwithstanding direct that a civil action be commenced maintained and prosecuted to completion against the public officer violating this section so as to recover all damages accruing to the city as a direct or indirect result of the violation of this section by such public officer 3 a knowing and wilful violation of this section shall constitute a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 or by a jail term of not more than ninety 90 days or both f distribution of the code of ethics section the city clerk shall cause a copy of this section to be distributed to every public officer within thirty 30 days after enactment each public officer elected or appointed or engaged thereafter shall be furnished a copy of this section and any amendments with respect thereto before entering upon the duties of office g severability if any provision of this section is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unconstitutional or if the application of this section to any person or circumstances is found to be invalid or unconstitutional such invalidity or unconstitutionality shall not affect the other provisions or applications of this section which can be given effect without the invalid or unconstitutional provision or application i 41194  ii 71398 editors note  adopted  amended  229 to read as herein set out former  229 pertained to a definitions unless the provisions explicitly state otherwise as used in this section the following terms and phrases shall have the meanings hereinafter designated 1 alcoholic beverage any alcoholic liquor as defined now and hereafter by the revised statutes of missouri currently alcoholic liquor is defined by rsmo  2 control any form of authority regulation responsibility or dominion including a possessory right 3 drug a controlled substance as defined and described now or hereafter by the revised statutes of missouri currently controlled substances are defined and described by rsmo  of the revised statues of missouri  4 minor a person not legally permitted by reason of age to possess consume or purchase alcoholic liquor as described now or hereafter by the revised statutes of missouri 5 open house party a social gathering at a residence or premises of persons in addition to the owner or those with rights of possession or their immediate family members 6 residence or premises a motel room hotel room home apartment condominium or other dwelling unit including the curtilage of a dwelling unit or a hall meeting room or other place of assembly whether occupied as a dwelling or specifically for social functions and whether owned leased rented or used with or without compensation b prohibited activities no person who is the owner in possession a tenant or subtenant or has temporary charge of any residence or premises shall allow an open house party to take place at the residence or premises if any alcoholic beverage or drug is possessed or consumed at the residence or premises by any minor where the person knew or reasonably should have known that any alcoholic beverage or drug was in the possession or being consumed by a minor at the residence or premises and where the person failed to take reasonable steps to prevent the possession or consumption of the alcoholic beverage or drug at the residence or premises the provisions of this section shall not apply to 1 the consumption use or possession of a drug by a minor pursuant to a lawful prescription for each drug 2 religious observance or prescribed medical treatments 3 the possession by a minor of alcoholic beverages or lawfully prescribed drugs incidental to the lawful employment of such minor c penalty any person violating any provision of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment for not more than ninety 90 days or by both such fine and imprisonment i 41000 of these breeds ii 12218 division 2  dangerous dogs dangerous dogs a it is unlawful for any person to own harbor or possess a dangerous dog except as allowed by the provisions of this section the municipal court judge or hearing examiner may declare a dog dangerous 1 when evidence shows an attack or bite to a human is a level 4 or higher on the dunbar scale set forth in section 431  or 2 when evidence shows an attack upon another domestic animal is a level 4 or higher on the dunbar scale and a pattern of vicious behavior such as habitually snapping charging growling or otherwise manifests a disposition to bite attack or injure any person or domestic animal or pet if afforded the opportunity or if in the judgment of the court or administrative tribunal it causes any person to have a reasonable fear of immediate serious physical injury  or 3 when evidence shows an attack or bite to a human is less than a level 4 on the dunbar scale and pattern of vicious behavior such as habitually snapping charging growling or otherwise manifests a disposition to bite attack or injure any person domestic animal or pet if afforded the opportunity or if in the judgment of the court or administrative tribunal it causes any person to have a reasonable fear of immediate serious physical injury 4 has been previously found to be dangerous by another entity and the owner or keeper received notice of such b it is unlawful for any person to violate any restriction imposed by this section after a dog has been declared a dangerous dog by order of the municipal court or by order of the hearing examiner c upon the filing of the affidavit of the animal control officer with the municipal prosecutor alleging the dog is a dangerous dog and upon the motion of the prosecutor the judge of the municipal court may order any of the following that the dog be seized and impounded that the dog be impounded past the rabies observation period or that the dog be impounded during the pendency of charges and appeal and not be released while the charges or appeal are pending without order of the municipal judge upon the recommendation from the hearing examiner d administrative process 1 the city may at any time initiate an administrative hearing in writing to determine if a dog is dangerous pursuant to this chapter if a dog is being held pursuant to a municipal court order as an alleged dangerous dog the owner of the dog may request an administrative hearing in writing to the deputy city clerk the hearing shall be held within twentyfive 25 days of the request unless continued based upon a showing of good cause the hearing examiner as appointed by the city administrator shall take evidence and determine if the facts support a finding that the dog is dangerous if the hearing examiner finds the dog to be dangerous an order shall be entered consistent with the remedies set forth in this section no penalty provided for in section 2270 shall be imposed by the hearing examiner the hearing examiner shall not be a judge of the municipal court 2 any dog declared dangerous by the hearing examiner may be ordered humanely euthanized upon the expiration of the appeal period 3 any dog declared dangerous by the hearing examiner and not ordered euthanized and as a condition of residing within the corporate limits of the city shall be required to meet the following mandated restrictions a microchip that a microchip has been placed into the dog by the animal control authority for the purpose of registering such dog with the city the microchip shall contain the owners keepers or harborers generated and assigned dangerous dog registration number and such other information as required pursuant to the rules and regulations of the city the animal control authority shall keep records of the microchip placement and of the registration number it shall be a violation of this a microchip to be removed unless it is for a medical reason and then only by a licensed practicing veterinarian the animal control authority must be notified immediately of said removal b the dog shall be securely confined indoors or in a securely enclosed and locked kennel or cage the kennel or cage shall be the size appropriate to the size of the dog kept therein minimum dimensions of five 5 feet by ten 10 feet and shall provide adequate ventilation shade from the sun and protection from the elements in the event of a dispute over the appropriate size the guidelines of the state department of agriculture regulations for animal care facilities shall apply the kennel or cage must be constructed with ninegauge steel chain link such kennel or cage must have secure sides a secure top and secure bottom or floor attached to the sides or the sides must be embedded in the ground in addition the kennel or cage must have a doubleblind entrance and must be locked with a key or combination lock when such dog is within the structure any such kennel or cage must be located at least twentyfive 25 feet from the nearest point to the dwelling of another a church a school or a place of business of another and must comply with all zoning and building regulations of the city 1 notice a conspicuous notice which shall be at least two 2 feet by three 3 feet posted at the place of confinement and on the premises stating dangerous dog in at least twoinch block letters and contain the international symbol for danger as to warn the public of the nature of the dog therein confined 2 no dangerous dog shall be confined by an electronic fence or an electric collar electronic collars may not be used to control a dangerous dog when it is off the owners keepers harborers or maintainers property 3 no dangerous dog may be kept on a porch patio or in any part of a house or structure that would allow the dog to exit such structure on its own volition in addition no dangerous dog shall be kept in a house or structure when the windows are open or when screen windows or screen doors are the only barrier preventing the animal from exiting the structure c no person shall permit a dangerous dog to go outside its kennel cage or secure structure unless that person is age eighteen 18 or older that person has the dog securely leashed to a buckle collar and on a leash no longer than six 6 feet in length and that person has physical control of the dog such dog shall not be leashed to inanimate objects such as trees posts and buildings additionally such dog on a leash outside the dogs kennel cage or secure structure must be muzzled by a humane muzzling device sufficient to prevent the dog from biting persons or other animals d the dog shall not be allowed by remedy to be removed from the city to a location outside of the city limits unless ordered by the municipal judge e any dog declared dangerous by the hearing examiner cannot be sold given away or ownership otherwise transferred without the expressed permission of the animal control authority f as it is maintained and utilized for law enforcement purposes i 12218 dunbar scale a level 1 obnoxious or aggressive behavior but no skincontact by teeth b level 2 skincontact by teeth but no skinpuncture however may be skin nicks less than onetenth  110  of an inch deep and slight bleeding caused by forward or lateral movement of teeth against skin but no vertical punctures c level 3 one to four 4 punctures from a single bite which may have lacerations in a single direction caused by victim pulling hand away owner pulling dog away or gravity little dog jumps bites and drops to floor d level 4 one to four 4 punctures from a single bite with deep bruising around the wound such as when a dog held on and bore down or lacerations in both directions such as when a dog held on and shook its head from side to side e level 5 multiplebite incident with at least two 2 level 4 bites or multipleattack incident with at least one level 4 bite in each f level 6 victim dead i 12218 reserved article iii  rabies control rabid animals a every rabid animal or animal exposed to rabies shall be immediately confined by the owner who shall promptly notify a police officer or the animal control officer the owner shall surrender such animal for quarantine in the city animal shelter or a licensed veterinary hospital  provided that if the owner elects to place the animal in a hospital he shall be responsible for all costs the animal may be quarantined a maximum of ten 10 days but shall be released earlier if certified by a licensed veterinarian to be free of rabies b no person shall euthanize a rabid animal or an animal exposed to rabies  nor remove such an animal from the city without permission from the animal control authority except when it is necessary to euthanize such animal to prevent it from escaping or from biting any other animal or person c the body of any animal having been exposed to rabies prior to death shall be surrendered by the owner upon demand of the animal control authority i 12218 impoundment of animal when person bitten in the event any dog or other domesticated animal shall bite injure or attack any person the owner or harborer of such animal shall take such animal to the city animal shelter or to a licensed veterinarian for observation i 12218 animal to be released when there is no evidence of rabies if within such period of observation such animal or dog does not develop or manifest evidence of hydrophobia or rabies or other disease communicable to human beings such animal may be redeemed by the owner upon the payment of boarding fees as determined by the animal control authority or veterinarian all animals under clinical observation for rabies must fulfill all other conditions of this chapter prior to release at the time of the biting a summons shall be issued to the owner if in violation of any other parts of this chapter i 12218 when animal to be confined on owners premises if it be the judgment of a licensed his premises  provided that such owner keeper or harborer shall deliver such dog or animal to such veterinarian for examination every other day during such observation period i 12218 disposition of diseased animals it is further provided that if such dog or animal does manifest symptoms of disease as heretofore referred to as determined by the animal control officer or veterinarian if it is then examination i 12218 general quarantine of animals when the animal control officer shall deem it necessary because of the prevalence of rabies among the animal population of the city county or state in the owners home or tied up or placed on a leash and under the direct physical control of a person at least eighteen 18 years of age violation of this regulation shall be a misdemeanor any dog cat or other animal found otherwise during such a quarantine shall be impounded i 12218 entry on private property by animal control and public safety officers the animal control officer or their designee provisions of this article to provide a just equitable and practicable method for the repairing vacation or demolition of buildings or structures which may endanger the life limb health morals property safety or welfare of the general public or their occupants and shall apply to all dangerous buildings as herein defined which are now in existence or which may hereafter be constructed in the city  12378   22789 what constitutes a dangerous building all buildings or structures which have any or all of the following defects shall be deemed dangerous buildings a those whose interior walls or other vertical structural members list lean or buckle to such an extent that a plumbline passing center of gravity falls outside of the middle third of its base b those which exclusive of the foundation show thirtythree 33 per cent or more of damage or deterioration of the supporting member or members or fifty 50 per cent of damage or deterioration of the nonsupporting enclosing or outside walls or covering c those which have improperly distributed loads upon the floors or roofs in which the same are overloaded or which have insufficient strength to be reasonably safe for the purpose used d those which have been damaged by fire wind or other cause so as to become dangerous to life safety morals or the general health and welfare of the occupants or the people of the city e those which are so dilapidated decayed unsafe insanitary or which so utterly fail to provide the amenities essential to decent living that they are unfit for human habitation or are likely to cause sickness or disease so as to work injury to the health morals safety or general welfare of those occupying such building f those having light air and sanitation facilities which are inadequate to protect the health morals safety or general welfare of human beings who live or may live therein g those having inadequate facilities for egress in case of fire or panic or those having insufficient stairways elevators fire escapes or other means of communication h those which have parts thereof which are so attached that they may fall and injure members of the public or property i those which because of their condition are unsafe insanitary or dangerous to the health safety morals or general welfare of the people of this city j those buildings existing in violation of any provisions of the building code or fire prevention code or other ordinances of this city  12378   22789 declared public nuisances all dangerous buildings within the terms of section 627 are hereby declared to be public nuisances and shall be repaired vacated and repaired or vacated and demolished as hereinbefore and hereinafter provided  12379   22789 emergencies in case where it reasonably appears that there is the same manner as provided in subsection f of section 633  12378   22789 standards for repair vacation or demolition the following standards shall be followed in substance by the chief building official in ordering repair vacation or demolition a if the dangerous building can reasonably be repaired so that it will no longer be in violation of the terms of this article it shall be ordered repaired b if the dangerous building is in such condition as to make it dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of its occupants it shall be ordered to be vacated c in any case where a dangerous building is fifty 50 per cent damaged decayed or deteriorated it shall be repaired or demolished in all cases where a building cannot be repaired so that it will no longer be in violation of the terms of this article it shall be demolished in all cases where a dangerous building is a fire hazard existing or erected in violation of the terms of the article or any ordinance of this city or statute of the state it shall be repaired or demolished  12378   22789   insurance proceeds from damage or loss to buildings or structures if there are proceeds of any insurance policy based upon a footnotes  6  cross reference city boards and commissions  210351 et seq purpose there is hereby created a board of appeals consisting of five 5 members and five 5 alternates the composition and 22789  ib 9803 right of appeal any decision of the building official in the enforcement of the codes of liberty missouri may be appealed to the board by any person aggrieved or by any officer official by filing with the building official a written notice of appeal specifying the grounds therefore before the board is called the applicant shall deposit a fee if any as set forth in the schedule of fees in full force and effect having been approved by the city council and on file in the office of the deputy city clerk the building official shall forthwith transmit to the board all papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed from is taken an appeal stays all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed from unless the building official certifies to the board after the notice of appeal shall have been filed with him that by reason of the facts stated therein a stay would in his opinion cause imminent peril to life or property in such case proceedings 22789 powers and duties the board shall have the power to approve the use of alternate materials equipment and types of construction whenever in any specific case the board shall find and determine that the application of a general rule or regulation governing such use will by reason of exceptional circumstances or conditions constitute a practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship and shall have the power to hear and render decisions on all appeals from the decisions of the building official the board shall further be empowered to interpret the intent of the codes in specific cases and to authorize responsible minimum variance from the literal provisions of the codes where it is determined that such variance is for the purpose intended at least the equivalent of that prescribed in the codes with respect to quality strength effectiveness fire resistance durability and safety the board shall also constitute the board of examiners of the city as provided in section 67 of this board shall have the power to revoke a license if it finds that the holder of such license has willfully violated the provisions of this other ordinances pertaining to the work for which the license was issued all rulings and actions of the board shall be consistent with the spirit and intent of the codes with respect to safety of human life the board shall adopt reasonable rules and regulations for its conduct as it may deem necessary to carry out the requirements of the codes  4984   22789 composition and appointment 1 composition the board shall consist of five 5 members and five 5 new conveyances  4984   22789   51192  i 6997 definitions for the purpose of this article certain terms are defined as follows ansi mean american national standards institute 1711987 national standard safety elevators and escalators published by the american society of mechanical engineers elevator contractor shall mean any person or organization who regularly engages in the installation alternation modernization repair maintenance andor service of elevator equipment  4984   22789  i 6997 requirements for operation and maintenance 1 general the owner of elevators dumbwaiters and escalators shall be responsible for the safe operation and maintenance of each elevator dumbwaiter or escalator and shall cause periodic inspections tests and maintenance to be made on such conveyances as required in this section 2 annual inspections and tests except in dwelling units elevators dumbwaiters and escalators shall be inspected at least every twelve 12 months by a special inspector who shall be an elevator contractor such inspections shall include tests of the car and counterweight safeties governors and oil buffers to be made in accordance with the ansi inspections and tests for hydraulic elevators in accordance with the ansi be required 3 fiveyear maintenance inspection tests except in dwelling units maintenance inspection and tests of elevator cars and counterweight safeties governors and oil buffers shall be made at intervals not exceeding five 5 years in accordance with the ansi by a person employed by an elevator contractor and qualified to perform such service 4 inspection costs all costs of such inspections and tests shall be paid by the owner 5 inspection reports after each required inspection a full and correct report of such inspection shall be filed with the building official of the city  4984   22789 unsafe conditions when an inspection reveals an unsafe condition the elevator contractor performing the inspection shall immediately file with the owner and the building official a full and true report of such inspection and such unsafe condition if the building official finds that the unsafe condition endangers human life he shall cause to be placed on such elevator dumbwaiter or escalator in a conspicuous place a notice stating that such conveyance is unsafe the owner shall see to it that such notice is legibly maintained where placed by the building official the building official shall also issue an order in writing to the owner requiring the repairs or alterations to be made to such conveyance which are necessary to render it safe and may order the operation thereof discontinued until the repairs or alterations are made or the unsafe conditions removed a posted notice of unsafe conditions shall be removed only by the building official when he is satisfied that the unsafe conditions are met  4984   22789 exclusions the following shall be excluded from the building code adopted in section 646 a certificate of inspection b fees c operation and maintenance i 6997 secs 651659  reserved article x  residential rental occupancy code footnotes  7  cross reference fair housing ch 12a  fire protection general provisions a legislative finding this code shall be known as the residential rental occupancy the city of liberty hereinafter referred to as this code the activities hereinafter prohibited are determined to be nuisances and it is further determined that a failure to comply with the standards set forth herein is also a nuisance a nuisance is defined herein as to the maintenance or occupancy of a rental building as an activity or condition which if not property corrected would constitute a fire hazard or a serious threat to life health and safety of the occupants or others within said building the regulation of residential buildings such as apartments hotels roominghouses boardinghouses or other like apartments or other like structures is necessary to secure the general health of the inhabitants of the city of liberty missouri b purpose the purpose of this code is to correct achieve and maintain such a level of nonowneroccupied residential environmental quality  as well as protect and promote public health safety and general welfare c scope the provisions of this code shall apply uniformly to the construction maintenance use and occupancy of all existing residential buildings and structures other than owner occupied 1 52687 definitions the following definitions shall apply in the interpretation and enforcement of this code accessory building by unwanted individuals properly connected shall mean connected in accordance with all applicable codes and ordinances of the city of liberty as from time to time enforced  provided however that the application of this definition shall not require the alteration or replacement of any connection in good working order and not constituting a hazard to life or health rat harborage shall mean any conditions or place where rats can live nest or seek shelter rat proofing shall mean a form of construction which will prevent the ingress or egress of rats to or from a given space or building or from gaining access to food water or harborage it consists of the closing and keeping closed of every opening in foundations basements cellars exterior and interior walls ground or first floors roofs sidewalk gratings sidewalk openings and other places that may be reached and entered by rats by climbing burrowing or other methods by the use of materials impervious to rat gnawing refuse shall mean all putrescible and nonputrescible solids except body wastes including garbage rubbish ashes and dead animals refuse container shall mean a watertight container that is constructed of metal or other durable material impervious to rodents that is capable of being serviced without creating insanitary conditions or such other containers as have been approved by the appropriate authority openings into the container such as covers and doors shall be tight fitting rooming unit shall mean any room or group of rooms forming a single habitable unit used or intended to be used for living and sleeping but not for cooking purposes roominghouse shall mean any dwelling other than a hotel or motel or that part of any dwelling containing one or more rooming units in which persons either individually or as families are housed with or without meals being provided rubbish shall mean nonputrescible solid wastes excluding ashes consisting of either a combustible wastes such as paper cardboard plastic containers yard clippings and wood  or b noncombustible wastes such as tin cans glass and crockery safety shall mean the condition of being reasonably free from danger and hazards which may cause accidents or disease space heater shall mean a selfcontained heating appliance of either convection type or the radiant type and intended primarily to heat only a limited space or area such as one room or two 2 adjoining rooms supplied shall mean paid for furnished by provided by or under the control of the owner operator or agent temporary housing shall mean any tent trailer mobile home or any other structure used for human shelter which is designed to be transportable and which is not attached to the ground to another structure or to any utility system on the same premises for more than thirty 30 consecutive days toxic substance shall mean any chemical product applied on the surface of or incorporated into any structural or decorative material which constitutes a potential conditions require refrigeration for safe keeping  and a counter or table for food preparation  said cabinets andor shelves and counter or tables shall be of sound construction furnished with surfaces expected to provide same on occupancy and that sufficient space and adequate connections for the safe and efficient installation and operation of said stove refrigerator andor similar devices are provided 2 within every dwelling unit there shall be a nonhabitable room which affords privacy to a person within said room and which is equipped with a flush water closet in good working condition closet to be operated properly and shall be properly connected to a sewer system which is approved by the director of community development 3 within every dwelling unit there shall be a lavatory sink provides at all times an adequate amount of heated and unheated running water under pressure and which is properly connected to a sewer system approved by the director of community development water inlets for lavatory sinks shall be located above the overflow rim of these facilities 4 within every dwelling unit there shall be a room which affords privacy to a person within said room and which is sewer system approved by the director of community development water inlets for bathtubs shall be located above the overflow rim of these facilities 5 every dwelling unit shall have at least two 2 following requirements 1 every foundation roof floor exterior and interior wall ceiling inside and outside stair every porch and appurtenance thereto shall be safe to use and capable of supporting the loads that normal use may cause to be placed thereon and shall be kept in sound condition and good repair every inside and outside stair or step shall have risers and treads which are uniform to the others in that staircase 2 every foundation roof exterior wall door sky light and window shall be reasonably weathertight and watertight and shall be kept in sound condition and good repair floors during that portion of the year when there is a need for protection existing screen doors and windows shall be maintained in a sound condition 5 every dwelling multiple dwelling roominghouse or accessory structure and the premises on which located shall be maintained in a ratfree and ratproof condition a all openings in the exterior walls foundations basements ground or first floors and roofs which have a halfinch diameter or more opening shall be ratproof if they are within fortyeight 48 inches of the existing exterior ground level immediately below such openings or if they may be reached by rats from the ground by climbing unguarded pipes wires cornices stairs roofs and other items such as trees or vines or by burrowing b all windows located at or near ground level used or intended to be used for ventilation all other openings located at or near ground level and all exterior doorways which might provide an entry for rats shall be supplied with adequate screens or such other devices as will effectively prevent the entrance of rats into the structure c all sewers pipes drains or conduits and openings around such pipes and conduits shall be constructed to prevent the ingress or egress of rats to or from a building d interior floors of basements cellars and other areas in contact with the soil shall be ratproof in an approved manner e materials stored outside the dwelling shall be stacked and elevated so that there will be at least an eighteeninch opening between the material and the ground level so as to prevent the creation of a rat harborage area no stacking or piling of material shall take place against the exterior walls of the structure 6 accessory structures present or provided by the owner agent or tenant occupant on the premises of a dwelling shall be structurally sound and be maintained in good repair and free of insects and rats or such structures shall be removed from the premises the exterior of such structures shall be made weatherresistant use of decayresistant materials or the use of leadfree paint or other preservatives 7 every plumbing fixture and all water and waste pipes shall be properly installed and maintained in good sanitary working condition 8 every water closet compartment bathroom and kitchen floor surface shall be constructed and maintained so as to be reasonably impervious to water and so as to permit such floor to be easily kept in a clean and sanitary condition 9 every plumbing fixture and pipe every chimney flue and smoke pipe and every other facility piece of equipment or utility which is present in a dwelling or dwelling unit or which is required under this code shall be constructed installed and maintained in conformance with the appropriate statutes ordinances and regulations of the city of liberty and the state of missouri 10 no owner operator or occupant shall cause any service facility equipment or utility which is required under this code to be removed from or shut off 52687 notice of violation a whenever the director of community development determines that any dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit or the premises surrounding any of these fails to meet the requirements set forth in this code or in applicable rules and regulations issued pursuant thereto the director of community development in accordance with existing legislation shall issue a notice setting forth the alleged failures and advising the owner occupant operator or agent that such failures must be corrected this notice shall 1 be in writing  2 set forth the alleged violations of this code or of applicable rules and regulations issued pursuant thereto  3 describe the dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit where the violations are alleged to exist or to have been committed such written notice shall specify an appropriate or acceptable method of correction  4 specify a specific date for the correction of any violation alleged  and 5 be served upon the owner occupant operator or agent of the dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit personally or by registered mail return receipt requested addressed to the owner occupant operator or agent if one or more persons to whom such notice is addressed cannot be found after diligent effort to do so service may be made upon such persons by posting the notice in or about the dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit described in the notice or by causing such notice to be published in a newspaper of general circulation for a period of consecutive days b at the end of the period of time allowed for the correction of any violation alleged the director of community development shall reinspect the dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit described in the notice c if upon reinspection the violations are determined by the director of community development not to have been corrected the director of community development shall initiate legal proceedings as provided by appropriate statutes ordinances and regulations of the city of liberty and the state of missouri 14 52687 penalties it is unlawful for any person firm or corporation which is owner occupant operator or agent of a dwelling unit or rooming unit to violate disobey omit neglect or refuse to comply with or to resist enforcement of any of the provisions of this code or chapter and any such person firm or corporation who shall have received an order or notice of an alleged violation of this code or chapter shall have committed a misdemeanor and such person firm or corporation shall upon conviction be fined not less than five dollars $500 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 or serve not less than one or more than fifteen 15 days in jail or both for each day such alleged violation continues after expiration of the specified reasonable consideration period provided herein and provided that no such penalty shall be applicable while a reconsideration hearing or appeal to a court of competent jurisdiction is pending under the provisions of this code or chapter 15 52687 collection and dissemination of information the director of community development is hereby authorized to collect and disseminate information concerning techniques of maintenance repair and sanitation in housing and concerning the requirements of this code and applicable rules and regulations issued pursuant thereto 16 52687 appeals a there is hereby created a residential rental occupancy code board of appeals consisting of five 5 members and two 2 alternates the composition and appointment of which is hereinafter provided the purpose of this board is to provide for reasonable interpretations of the code and to consider requests from persons subject to requirements of this code for appropriate waivers from strict compliance b any decision of the director of community development in the enforcement of the residential rental occupancy code may be appealed to the board this appeal must be made within ten 10 days after receipt of the notice of violation and must be submitted in writing specifying the grounds therefor an appeal stays all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed except in the case of an emergency as described in c the board of appeals shall adopt reasonable rules and regulations for the conduct of its meetings and investigations and shall render all decisions and findings in writing to the director of community development all decisions and findings shall become part of the public record d the board of appeals shall fix a time for the hearing of the appeal within five 5 days of receipt of the request as well as due notice to the parties of interest and decide the same within a reasonable time in the hearing of appeals before the board all testimony objections thereto and rulings thereof shall be recorded upon the hearing before the board any person may appear in person or by agent or by attorney e at such a hearing the applicant shall be given an opportunity to be heard and to show cause why such notice or order should be modified extended withdrawn or a variance granted f the board of appeals by a majority vote may sustain modify or withdraw the notice or order in granting an extension or variance of any notice or order the board of appeals shall observe the following conditions 1 the board of appeals may grant an extension of time for the compliance of any order or notice for not more than eighteen 18 months subject to appropriate conditions and provided that the board of appeals makes specific findings of fact based on evidence relating to the following a that there are practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships in carrying out the strict letter of any notice or order  and b that such an extension is in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this code in securing the public health safety and general welfare 2 the board of appeals may grant a variance in a specific case and from a specific provision of this code subject to appropriate conditions and provided the board of appeals makes specific findings of fact based on evidence related to the following a that there are practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships in carrying out the strict letter of any notice of order  b that the effect of the application of the provisions would be arbitrary in the specific case  c that an extension would not constitute an appropriate remedy for these practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships and this arbitrary effect  and d that such variance is in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this code in securing the public health safety and general welfare g the composition and appointment of the board of appeals shall be as follows 1 composition the board of appeals shall consist of five 5 members and two 2 alternates attendance of four 4 members or alternates shall be considered a quorum at least one member shall be a person who is knowledgeable of the construction field the director of community development shall be an ex officio member and shall act as secretary to the board 2 appointment members and their alternates shall be appointed by the mayor and approved by the city council the term of office shall be for five 5 years excepting that the membership of the first board appointed shall serve respectively for terms of one member and one alternate for one year  one member and one alternate for two 2 years  one member for three 3 years  one member for four 4 years  and one member for five 5 years thereafter members and alternates shall be appointed for terms of five 5 years each vacancies shall be filled for the unexpired term only members or alternates may be removed for cause by the mayor and city council upon written charges and after a public hearing h no member of the board shall vote on any matter in which he has a direct or financial interest i all decisions of the board shall be by a majority vote of the attending members or their alternates  provided that a quorum is present all decisions of the board shall be in writing and shall be filed with the deputy city clerk with a copy to the appellant and the director of community development all decisions of the board shall be final 17 52687 city of liberty has a right to allow the public or the citys agents to pass for purposes of this article and the release for lawn sprinkler system in the city of liberty rightofway document specified hereunder the definition of rightofway set forth above shall apply whether the citys legal interest in the land is in fact a rightofway an easement a license or a fee simple interest lawn sprinkler system any system wholly or partly affixed or buried beneath the ground surface by which water is transported or hoses to sprinkler heads designed to spray water over the surrounding vegetation a system meets this definition if either the transmission pipes and hoses or the sprinkler heads are beneath the ground surface i 111097  i 1282013 permit required no lawn sprinkler system shall be constructed within the city of liberty in such a manner that any sprinkler head or other component part is located on city rightofway until the owner of the land to be benefitted by the system shall have first obtained a lawn sprinkler system permit i 111097 permit application the process for obtaining a lawn sprinkler system permit is as follows 1 the landowner shall complete an application for lawn sprinkler system permit rightofway permit and a release for lawn sprinkler system in the city of liberty rightofway document which shall be available in the office of the chief building official 2 the landowner shall then submit the application to the chief building official along with the release for lawn sprinkler system in the city of liberty document 3 the city engineer shall review the rightofway permit and the chief building official shall review the lawn sprinkler system permit and release for lawn sprinkler system in the city of liberty document to determine the following a that the application and release for lawn sprinkler system in the city of liberty rightofway document refer to the same property b that the application identifies all recorded owners of the property c that the proposed installation presents no threat to public safety d that the proposed installation presents no threat of damage to existing facilities of the city the citys lessees or those to whom the city has granted easements or licenses e that if anyone other than the landowner proposes to install the system then that person or firm is properly licensed under state law and local ordinance 4 if the chief building official finds that the applications meet the requirements set forth in paragraph 3 then the chief building official shall issue to the landowner a lawn sprinkler system permit and the city engineer shall issue a rightofway permit i 111097  i 1282013 editors note the forms for permit applications and the release and indemnification document have not been set out herein but are available in the office of the city engineer limitations on permits the granting of a permit pursuant to this article shall create no easement license or other right in the landowner other than the limited permissive use of the citys rightofway it shall be a condition of every permit that the landowner shall expressly release indemnify and hold harmless the city of liberty and its employees agents contractors lessees licensees and permittees on citys rightofway from any and all liability claims suits or demand whatsoever which they or others may now have or which may hereafter have arising out of the placement of sprinkler heads or related components in city rightofway including but not limited to any damage done to the landowners sprinkler system as a result of any activities the construction alteration or maintenance of towers 1 definition for purposes of this section the term tower shall mean a permanent structure having a total height in excess of fifty 50 feet measured from the ground and having one or more legs designed for the support of one or more sign antenna light wind turbine solar array or other object but excluding buildings serving other purposes and meeting the building requirements for all purposes a tower shall not include existing electric utility poles installed by a provider holding a certificate of convenience from the missouri psc and installed consistent with industry practice and in conformance with all otherwise applicable federal state and local requirements 2 safety fall zone required  all portions of any tower including related structures fences and walls except for parking associated with the wireless facility shall be separated from any public rightsofway sidewalk or street alley parking areas playground or other building and from the property line of any adjacent property at least a distance equal to the height of the tower towers shall be reasonably designed to reduce the potential damage to persons or property from falling ice or equipment from the tower or from wind damage or structural failure 3 safety fencing  in addition to other applicable requirements the tower and any appurtenances shall be safely maintained and fenced or otherwise secured to prevent unauthorized access or climbing of the tower barbed electrified or razor wire is prohibited tower legs shall be of monopole design without use of lattice or guy wire support and be engineered and designed with sufficient depth counterweight and other mechanisms to address windloading and other failure risks under all reasonably anticipated conditions and circumstances 4 structural analysis before any modifications or alterations to an existing tower may be approved a sealed structural analysis from a certified engineer must be submitted to the city as part of any application to alter or modify the same 5 lighting for safety concerns towers shall not be lighted unless required by the faa or other state or federal agency with authority to regulate in which case a description of the required lighting scheme will be made a part of the application to install build or modify the tower 6 storm water control any new tower or modification thereto shall be required to be reviewed for storm water control and shall comply with any storm water control requirements all towers constructed within a designated floodplain or floodway shall comply with all state local and federal requirements and obtain all necessary permits 7 paved access to ensure access to property to address any safety concerns on which the tower is located paved access to the tower and related facilities must be provided and maintained at all times that such tower andor related facilities are located on the property 8 incorporation all requirements in article xii of the liberty city apply to the construction modification and maintenance of each tower and are reincorporated herein as building code requirements to the extent permitted by law 9 abandonment bond any tower not operated for a period of six 6 months or more shall be deemed abandoned and the director shall cause notice of such determination to be sent and request for removal within a reasonable time not to exceed ninety 90 days if a tower is abandoned it shall be removed at the owners expense failure to comply with this provision shall constitute a public nuisance and building code violation that may be remedied by the city at the tower or property owners expense any applicant for a new tower shall place a bond or other security with the city prior to any final approval to ensure abandoned towers can be removed the bond or security shall be in the form and amount approved by the director the amount of the bond shall be determined by the director to satisfy the requirements hereof with regard to the specific tower to which it would apply based on the estimated total cost of removal of that tower b appeals  appeals by any aggrieved person of a final action of any city officer employee board commission or the city council that are claimed by an aggrieved person to be unlawful or an unconstitutional taking of property without compensation shall be receipts as represent charges for message rate roll or long distance service charges for exclusive interstate service of any kind charges for morse telegraph television or radio program transmission facilities or for other services furnished exclusively and permanently in connection with services extending beyond the boundaries of the city charges for the billing and collecting for telegrams commercial establishments the applicant may within twenty 20 days of such denial request an appeal of such denial to the city council who shall within fortyfive 45 days of the receipt of such appeal
